intro: Myriocarpa laevigata, commonly known as the smooth-seeded myriocarpa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its annual growth habit and erect, branching stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by spherical, smooth-seeded capsules. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Myriocarpa laevigata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
